messages.message:
Feature request/improvement - Human Review:

Currently, reviewers can only view final output field values/extractions. Sometimes, these outputs are the results of cleaning and reviewers should be able to access pre-cleaned values to truly review solution performance.

For example, reviewers might see "yes" for a document reasoning field representing whether or not a document is expired, but can't see that the "yes" was the result of a cleaning prompt that shortened a longer, more descriptive response.

Another example:
Reviewers might see a table output, but can't know or see that the table was the result of a cleaning prompt that reformatted a non-table output as a table. Also, should AI Hub (or a solution) have any issues with producing tables, there would be no way to tell as a reviewer what's happening nor why.

@Brian thanks for sharing - any additional context behind this (e.g. did this come from a customer/prospect)? I think this could be interesting for a more sophisticated reviewer persona, but am wondering if this story is a better fit for the new Tester role, which would have *read-only* access to projects.
Often times with reviewers, customers are mainly concerned with efficiency, so I would want to know more about why they'd need to see this level of detail in the configuration.

I once had issues with a simple "doc reasoning" field that would switch between the affirmative and negative between re-executions, and since I was only able to see the cleaning result (I think it was a binary), there was no way for me as someone who can just review runs to dig deeper and verify.

Also, sometimes cleaning steps can have issues for the same reasons as above.
thanks for the detail, makes sense!
